I hate to not leave a 5 star review but there is one big issue with this house that I think has to be mentioned. Location. It’s in a bad part of town and we didn’t feel safe. Sure enough about 4am our truck alarm went off from an attempted break in. Luckily we were already on edge so my husband was out the door quick, gun in hand, to scare off criminals. I think the only remedy is a secure gate to park your vehicle behind, double deadbolts on doors, and outdoor security cameras. We felt like we couldn’t leave any valuables in the house and we were dreading someone would smash out a window on our vehicle or do further damage to get in. We didn’t sleep for the rest of the night.
The only other issue with the house is an extremely low counter in the main bathroom, I’m 5’4” and had to stoop over to wash my hands, and the raw edge overhang on the counter was too close to the toilet, scratching me twice.
Outside of those two things the house is nice. Most importantly the house is very clean, the beds are comfortable, the blackout curtains are a nice bonus and it is nicely furnished. We didn’t use the kitchen so I don’t know how well it is stocked. Burt was easy to communicate with and I would rent from him again if he had a house in a different location. I’m sincerely sorry I had to leave a 4 star review, Burt was truly wonderful, but as a renter this is info I would want to know.

Raul, the hardworking, talented handyman and artist, greeted us and brought our bags down to start the tour. The whole family emits infectious positivity, despite the dark history of the place they call home.
While here, truly immerse yourself in the experience! Read some of the history from the books and magazines in his extensive collection, watch one of the atomic bomb history DVDs, go into the silo with just a flashlight and listen to the bats in silence, put yourself in the mindset of those who worked there.
Such a cool place to see and experience!

Gary is a historian of the era and the engineering of Atlas missile launch silos and buildings, and is eloquently able to describe why this place matters, both to the past and to present day geopolitics. This place (and others like it) are so obviously the love and focus of his life, that it is hard not to want delve into their history.
